body_html: @jgong5 Thanks for the benchmarks. The results look promising. The reason I was asking about the subgraph optimization is that we recently are working on supporting TensorRT, which also takes in a subgraph for accelerated runs. Difference is that it runs on GPU. If you folks have that ready, we can try something similar to #6696.
body_text: @jgong5 Thanks for the benchmarks. The results look promising. The reason I was asking about the subgraph optimization is that we recently are working on supporting TensorRT, which also takes in a subgraph for accelerated runs. Difference is that it runs on GPU. If you folks have that ready, we can try something similar to #6696.
body: @jgong5 Thanks for the benchmarks. The results look promising. The reason I was asking about the subgraph optimization is that we recently are working on supporting TensorRT, which also takes in a subgraph for accelerated runs. Difference is that it runs on GPU. If you folks have that ready, we can try something similar to https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/pull/6696.
